questions.question: What is the difference between preemption and non-preemption?

answers.a: Whether or not a ready process can be involuntarily terminated
answers.b: Whether or not a process in the middle of execution can be  interrupted
answers.c: Whether or not a blocked process can have its resources involuntarily taken away from it
answers.d: Waiting time is more in preemptive scheduling and less in non-preemptive

explanations.b: Preemptive scheduling - Processor can be preempted to execute a different process in the middle of execution of any current process.Non-preemptive scheduling - Once a Processor starts to execute a process it must finish it before executing the other. It cannot be paused in the middle.

questions.question: In which of the following Algorithms does the first process get allocated to the CPU first?

answers.c: can be preeptive or non preemptive

questions.question: In RR algorithm the new process will go to the :
What is the primary drawback of non-preemptive scheduling?

answers.c: Long waiting times for newly arrived processes

explanations.b: In non-preemptive scheduling, once a process starts executing, it cannot be preempted. This can cause lower-priority processes to starve if higher-priority processes are continuously running.

questions.question: Which of these metrics was least affected by the choice of scheduling type in the simulation?

explanations.b: Throughput is mostly independent of scheduling type and can be consistent across different scheduling strategies, as it measures the number of processes completed per unit of time.

questions.question: In preemptive scheduling, the CPU is allocated to a process:

answers.d: Until the process completes its execution

explanations.b: In preemptive scheduling, the CPU is allocated for a fixed time slice, after which the CPU can be taken away from the running process to be given to another process.
